comments:
If two projects reference one another in the same workspace and debug mode is
launched, Eclipse has an internal stack failure (most likely from an endless
recursive loop) and the debug mode crashes with the following error:

Internal Error occurred during: "Launching"

This error only occurs with CDT 3.0 on Eclipse 3.1. Older versions do not
experience this problem. Furthermore, the error is independent of the version of
the Java virtual machine being used (it's an Eclipse/CDT error, not the Java VM).

Here is the log dump from the crash:

java.lang.StackOverflowError
at
org.eclipse.core.internal.dtree.DeltaDataTree.getChildNodes(DeltaDataTree.java:489)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.dtree.DeltaDataTree.getChildren(DeltaDataTree.java:534)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTree.getChildIDs(ElementTree.java:331)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTree.getChildren(ElementTree.java:347)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Container.getChildren(Container.java:93)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Container.members(Container.java:188)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Container.members(Container.java:163)
at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.sourcelookup.containers.ContainerSourceContainer.createSourceContainers(ContainerSourceContainer.java:199)
at
org.eclipse.debug.core.sourcelookup.containers.ProjectSourceContainer.createSourceContainers(ProjectSourceContainer.java:92)
at
org.eclipse.debug.core.sourcelookup.containers.CompositeSourceContainer.getSourceContainers(CompositeSourceContainer.java:126)
at
org.eclipse.cdt.debug.internal.core.model.CDebugTarget.getSourceLookupPath(CDebugTarget.java:1654)
at
org.eclipse.cdt.debug.internal.core.model.CDebugTarget.getSourceLookupPath(CDebugTarget.java:1654)
at
org.eclipse.cdt.debug.internal.core.model.CDebugTarget.getSourceLookupPath(CDebugTarget.java:1654)

at
org.eclipse.cdt.debug.internal.core.model.CDebugTarget.getSourceLookupPath(CDebugTarget.java:1654)
at
org.eclipse.cdt.debug.internal.core.model.CDebugTarget.getSourceLookupPath(CDebugTarget.java:1654)

at
org.eclipse.cdt.debug.internal.core.model.CDebugTarget.getSourceLookupPath(CDebugTarget.java:1654)
at
org.eclipse.cdt.debug.internal.core.model.CDebugTarget.getSourceLookupPath(CDebugTarget.java:1654)

(This continues for several pages.)

In order to eliminate this error, I suggest that the CDT should first check for
doubly-referenced projects and inform the user accordingly (and not allow the
debug mode to launch).

Thanks and happy coding!
-Alex.

https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=110227 has been fixed in the 
Eclipse 3.1.2 branch.
Partial fix is applied to the 3.0.1 branch to prevent the initialization 
crashes.
